meanings.definition: A sudden and violent gust of wind.
meanings.sent1: The blast of wind knocked over the trash cans.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud blast of wind outside my window.
meanings.sent3: The blast of wind made my umbrella turn inside out!
meanings.sent4: The blast of wind felt like a powerful force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The sudden blast of wind caught everyone by surprise.

meanings.definition: A loud, sudden, and sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: The blast of the horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks made a loud blast in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The blast of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent4: The blast of the music filled the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The sudden blast of thunder made everyone jump.

meanings.definition: To explode or destroy with explosives.
meanings.sent1: The workers will blast the rocks to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: The demolition team will blast the old building tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally blasted the cake in the microwave!
meanings.sent4: The explosion blasted debris in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks blasted colorful lights into the sky.

meanings.sent1: The coach will blast the team for their poor performance.
meanings.sent2: The journalist blasted the government in her article.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to blast your idea, I just had some concerns.
meanings.sent4: Her words blasted through his confidence like a cannon.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's critique blasted through the student's enthusiasm.
